data.meanings: prayer, supplication, petition, oration, eulogy, benediction, commendation, blessing, honour, magnify, bring forth, follow closely, walk/follow behind closely, to remain attached.. In a horse race when the second horse follows the first one so closely that its head always overlaps the first horse’s body that horse is called AL-MUSSALLI (i.e. the one who follows closely / remains attached).. Central portion of the back, portion from where the tail of an animal comes out, the rump.
data.sentence: The word الصَّلَوةَ comes from the root ص ل و and is associated with the meanings: prayer, supplication, petition, oration, eulogy, benediction, commendation, blessing, honour, magnify, bring forth, follow closely, walk/follow behind closely, to remain attached.. In a horse race when the second horse follows the first one so closely that its head always overlaps the first horse’s body that horse is called AL-MUSSALLI (i.e. the one who follows closely / remains attached).. Central portion of the back, portion from where the tail of an animal comes out, the rump.

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)
data.sentence: The word اللَّيْلِ comes from the root ل ي ل and is associated with the meanings: night, evening. layl n.m. (f. laylah, pl. layali)

data.meanings: cut/divide lengthwise, break open, vent, incline/decline/deviate, dawn/sunrise/daybreak, source, abundantly and suddenly, ample bounty/generosity, a place from which water flows.
data.sentence: The word الْفَجْرِ comes from the root ف ج ر and is associated with the meanings: cut/divide lengthwise, break open, vent, incline/decline/deviate, dawn/sunrise/daybreak, source, abundantly and suddenly, ample bounty/generosity, a place from which water flows.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word أَقِمِ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: rubbing, squeezing, pressing, decline, sinking, become red, set, incline downwards from the meridian (sun). The whole phrase "duluk-as-shams" defined as "sunset" by Lane.
data.sentence: The word لِدُلُوكِ comes from the root د ل ك and is associated with the meanings: rubbing, squeezing, pressing, decline, sinking, become red, set, incline downwards from the meridian (sun). The whole phrase "duluk-as-shams" defined as "sunset" by Lane.

data.meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.
data.sentence: The word الشَّمْسِ comes from the root ش م س and is associated with the meanings: to be bright with sunshine, be glorious, be sunny. shams - sun.

data.meanings: darkness, the night; shed tears, poured water; intense coldness; watery/thick purulent matter that flows or drips; intensely red (applied to she-camel)
data.sentence: The word غَسَقِ comes from the root غ س ق and is associated with the meanings: darkness, the night; shed tears, poured water; intense coldness; watery/thick purulent matter that flows or drips; intensely red (applied to she-camel)

data.meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.

data.meanings: told/gave information, to witness/see, to be present, give evidence/testimony, bear witness. mushhad - time or place of being present or of giving or hearing evidence, meeting place. mashhuud - that which is witnessed.
data.sentence: The word مَشْهُودًا comes from the root ش ه د and is associated with the meanings: told/gave information, to witness/see, to be present, give evidence/testimony, bear witness. mushhad - time or place of being present or of giving or hearing evidence, meeting place. mashhuud - that which is witnessed.
